thread.title: Centennial boys basketball completes second-half rally to defeat Long Reach in 3A East quarterfinal

title: Centennial boys basketball completes second-half rally to defeat Long Reach in 3A East quarterfinal

text:
Centennial boys basketball completes second-half rally to defeat Long Reach in 3A East quarterfinal Centennial vs. Long Reach boys basketball File photo by Doug Kapustin 
Centennial's Kaleb Addisu, shown here earlier this season, helped the No. 3 Eagles to a 61-57 3A East quarterfinal win over No. 7 Long Reach on Tuesday, Feb. 28 at Centennial High School. 
Centennial's Kaleb Addisu, shown here earlier this season, helped the No. 3 Eagles to a 61-57 3A East quarterfinal win over No. 7 Long Reach on Tuesday, Feb. 28 at Centennial High School. (File photo by Doug Kapustin) Monica D'Ippolito Caption Long Reach vs. Reservoir boys basketball playoffs 
Long Reach's Tre'von Morgan talks about the Lightning's 58-53 first round playoff win over Reservoir on Friday, Feb. 24 at Reservoir High School. Morgan led his team with a game-high 16 points. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG). 
Long Reach's Tre'von Morgan talks about the Lightning's 58-53 first round playoff win over Reservoir on Friday, Feb. 24 at Reservoir High School. Morgan led his team with a game-high 16 points. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG). Caption Long Reach vs. Reservoir boys basketball playoffs 
Long Reach's Tre'von Morgan talks about the Lightning's 58-53 first round playoff win over Reservoir on Friday, Feb. 24 at Reservoir High School. Morgan led his team with a game-high 16 points. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG). 
Long Reach's Tre'von Morgan talks about the Lightning's 58-53 first round playoff win over Reservoir on Friday, Feb. 24 at Reservoir High School. Morgan led his team with a game-high 16 points. (Monica D'Ippolito/BSMG). Caption Wilde Lake boys basketball beats River Hill in 3A East quarterfinals 
Wilde Lake Boys Basketball players Marquis Bullett and Trea Keys talk about the Wildecats' 43-35 win over River Hill in the 3A East region quarterfinals on Tuesday, Feb. 28. (Brent Kennedy, Baltimore Sun Media Group) 
Wilde Lake Boys Basketball players Marquis Bullett and Trea Keys talk about the Wildecats' 43-35 win over River Hill in the 3A East region quarterfinals on Tuesday, Feb. 28. (Brent Kennedy, Baltimore Sun Media Group) Caption Wilde Lake boys basketball beats Hammond 
Wilde Lake sophomore Trea Keys talks about the Wildecats' 65-46 win over Hammond on Friday, Feb. 18. (Brent Kennedy/Howard County Times) 
Wilde Lake sophomore Trea Keys talks about the Wildecats' 65-46 win over Hammond on Friday, Feb. 18. (Brent Kennedy/Howard County Times) Caption Centennial boys basketball beats Mt. Hebron in playoffs 
Centennial guard Corey Eudell talks about the Eagles' 64-44 win over Mt. Hebron in the opening round of the 3A East playoffs on Friday, Feb. 24. (Brent Kennedy / BSMG) 
Centennial guard Corey Eudell talks about the Eagles' 64-44 win over Mt. Hebron in the opening round of the 3A East playoffs on Friday, Feb. 24. (Brent Kennedy / BSMG) Caption River Hill boys basketball beats Oakland Mills 
River Hill junior Jaden Martin talks about the Hawks' 69-64 win over Oakland Mills on senior night Wednesday, Feb. 15. (Brent Kennedy / Howard County Times) 
River Hill junior Jaden Martin talks about the Hawks' 69-64 win over Oakland Mills on senior night Wednesday, Feb. 15. (Brent Kennedy / Howard County Times) 
“I told the boys we are not going to beat them by 20 or 30 points. They are going to be a team that is going to stick in it,” said Lighting coach Andrew Lazzor. “They are going go, and we just hit shots early on. Between the flow of the game there are going to be runs and we made ours early it so happened, as opposed to making that run late as we’ve done.” 
Centennial slowly clawed its way back in the following eight minutes, however, thanks to a crucial 7-2 run to end the half. 
Elijah White was the catalyst, as he started off the period strong, ripping down an offensive board and getting the and-1 on the made put-back. 
He then drained a three to begin Centennial’s late surge with 2:05 left in the half. Andrew Hohmann extended the run before White came up with a deflection at half court with seconds ticking down. Kaleb Addisu picked up the loose ball and dished it off to Corey Eudell in transition to cut the deficit, 29-21, with 2.3 seconds to spare before the break. 
“The second quarter energy defensively was completely different,” Hollwedel said. “We went off that defensive energy in the second quarter, so the message was just coming out in the third and set the tone defensively first and it got us going in transition, got us making our jump shots a little bit, which early we settled for.” 
White settling in from range in the third quarter. He hit his first three with 6:23 left in the period and then knocked down back-to-back 3-pointers midway through the quarter, which cut the deficit to four. 
“I told my team if we can get within 10 points, we can get this and we did it,” White said. “Coach told us to turn it up on defense. They didn’t really handle the pressure well toward the end. I think that was due to fatigue, but we started turning them over and got our offense running. We got a lot of fast break points and then just spreading them out. They wanted to play that zone, so spreading them out and getting our shots going. It just happened that I had the hot hand today, so I kept shooting until I went cold and then we kept trying to move the ball around.”
